intro: Boeberoides, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It consists of a single species, Boeberoides acutifolius, native to the southern United States. The plant is characterized by its arrow-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. The plant contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals.
